paragraphs.content: Chapter 4
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 4

paragraphs.content: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

paragraphs.content: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

paragraphs.content: For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

paragraphs.content: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

paragraphs.content: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

paragraphs.content: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

paragraphs.content: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

paragraphs.content: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

paragraphs.content: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

paragraphs.content: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

paragraphs.content: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

paragraphs.content: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

paragraphs.content: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.

paragraphs.content: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

paragraphs.content: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

paragraphs.content: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

paragraphs.content: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

paragraphs.content: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

paragraphs.content: ¶ My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

paragraphs.content: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

paragraphs.content: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

paragraphs.content: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

paragraphs.content: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

paragraphs.content: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

paragraphs.content: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
